explanation: formal; showing hard work, care, and attention to detail
sentence: The government has been assiduous in the fight against inflation.

explanation: (of legs) bending out at the knees
sentence: She had bent, slightly bandy legs.

explanation: providing the right conditions for something good to happen or exist
sentence: A quiet room is a more conducive atmosphere for studying.

explanation: the female of animals such as the deer or rabbit
sentence: The doe is of a light fawn color and has no horns.

explanation: extremely bad in a way that is very noticeable
sentence: It was an egregious error for a statesman to show such ignorance.

sentence: Namely, it is the argument that has been updated towards the end of the previous paragraph which needs especial care.

explanation: an argument that has existed for a long time between two people or groups, causing a lot of anger or violence
sentence: The mayor has a longstanding feud with the media.

sentence: As the evening wore on the dancing got more and more frenzied.

explanation: informal; to look at something or someone in a stupid or rude way
sentence: Don't sit there gawking like that - give me a hand!

sentence: The sound of his grating voice complaining all day was driving me crazy.

explanation: to travel by getting free rides in someone else's vehicle
(of speech and writing) the quality of being possible to understand
sentence: Foreign accented speech may affect intelligibility.
She was a very placid (= calm and not easily excited) child who slept all night and hardly ever cried.

explanation: formal; to spoil something that is pure or someone's perfect reputation
sentence: His reputation, he said, had been unfairly sullied by half-truths and innuendos.

explanation: to move very quickly and easily through the air, especially down from a high position in order to attack; to make a sudden attack on a place or group of people in order to surround and catch them
sentence: The eagle swooped down to snatch a young rabbit.
